intro: Parosela rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Parosela rubricaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a subtle, aromatic scent.
